wikipedia_page.main: Air Vice Marshal Colin Peter Brown  & Bar (20 December 1898 – 19 October 1965) was a Scottish officer who began his career in the Royal Naval Air Service during the First World War, before transferring to the Royal Air Force (RAF). A flying ace credited with 14 aerial victories, he remained in the RAF and served throughout the Second World War, retiring in 1954.

response: * Colin Brown (RAF officer) (1898–1965), World War I flying ace with 14 victories
* Colin Brown (jockey) (born 1955), English National Hunt jockey active in the 1980s
* Colin Brown (film journalist) (born 1962), British editor-in-chief of Screen International
* Colin Brown (American football) (born 1985), offensive lineman for the Buffalo Bills
